snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and leading mayoral candidates rebuked Charles J. Hynes, the Brooklyn district attorney, for his handling of sex-abuse cases in the ultra-Orthodox community.
abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg sharply criticizes Brooklyn district attorney Charles J Hynes over his handling of child sexual abuse cases among the borough's large ultra-Orthodox Jewish community; ultra-Orthodox advocacy group announced in 2011 that adherent Jews must obtain permission from a rabbi before reporting allegations, a position that could conflict with state law.

byline.original: By RAY RIVERA and SHARON OTTERMAN

lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and leading mayoral candidates rebuked Charles J. Hynes, the Brooklyn district attorney, for his handling of sex-abuse cases in the ultra-Orthodox community.

headline.seo: Bloomberg Among Critics of Brooklyn District Attorney
headline.main: Bloomberg Among Critics of Prosecutor in Brooklyn
